definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: senselessness (as shewn in disregard of moral and religious claims), esp. of disgraceful sins; also disgrace;—alw. abs. ´[[נ]];—

disgraceful folly, esp. of sins of un-chastity Ju Jdg 19:23 (wanton deed GFM), so [[דְּבַר]] [[הַזּאׁת]] ´[[הַנּ]] v:Jdg 19:24, 2Sa 13:12; oft. [[בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל]] ´[[עָשָׂה נ]] i.e. do a thing disgraceful acc. to Isr.'s standard: Ge 34:7 (J), De 22:21 (cf. Dr on mng. of wd.; only here of woman), Ju Jdg 20:26 (+ [[זִמָּה]]), v:Jdg 20:10, Je 29:23 (cf. [[לאׁ יֵעָשֶׂה כֵּן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵלּ]] 2Sa 13:12); also of inhospitable churlishness 1Sa 25:25 (v. I, II. [[נׇבָל]], and esp. Is 32:6); of profane action Jos 7:15 (Achan; ´[[עָשָׂה נ]] [[בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל]]); of senseless and irreligious language Is 9:16 [[דּׂבֵר]] Is 32:6 ([[יְדַבֵּר]]).

contumely, disgrace ´[[עֲשׂוֹת עִמָּכֶם נ]] Job 42:8 (of ´[[י]]), i.e. deal out to you disgrace, expose you and punish you as [[נְבָלִים]] (cf. 2Sa 3:33, sub [[נׇבָל]]), because of your utterances about me.
